Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2010 02:46PM Sandy7 wrote: Thanks for the reply.  I just got home from speaking with the Surgeon.  She was very nice, but insists that the procedure must be termed "partial mastectomy" in order for the billing agent to code it correctly for payment.  It was really bothering me, but after reading your post I feel better - thanks again.
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy vs partial mastectomy for insurance purposes Sandy7 Sandy7

Posts.Content: Sandy7 wrote: Small cluster of ?calcification found on Mammogram.  Can't do stereotactic biopsy due to location of cluster - too far back near the chest wall.  Scheduled for needle guided excisional biopsy but the paperwork says "partial Mastectomy".  The PA showed me the tiny amount that would be taken out and said that the insurance companies just like it being termed a partial mastectomy.  I don't like it and it's not sitting right with me.  I have appt w/Surgeon tomorrow to discuss.  Does it have to be worded that way for insurance purposes?  I just feel like she's covering herself incase something goes wrong.  Any thoughts?
